intro: Matricaria multicaulis, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny white or yellow flowers arranged in a disc shape. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features linear, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Matricaria multicaulis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides. It is also known for its medicinal properties, with the flowers used in herbal remedies for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
